title: Blackwater paved the way for Wagner
description: The use of contractors in the US 'war on terror' inspired Russia and other powers to outsource war.

title: Indian Muslims in Haryana face calls for economic boycott after violence
description: Hindu far-right groups call for northern Haryana state residents to boycott Muslim shops.

title: King of Jordan approves ‘draconian’ cybercrime law
description: Fourteen rights groups, including Human Rights Watch, previously said in a joint statement the law is 'draconian'.

title: What is behind the complex deal between the US and Iran?
description: Tehran and Washington agree to exchange prisoners and release billions in frozen assets.

title: Palestinian officials welcome first Saudi Arabia ambassador
description: The ambassador's appointment occurred while the US is looking to normalise Israeli-Saudi relations.

title: West African bloc scraps crisis meeting on Niger coup
description: As ECOWAS leaders fail to meet, concerns over the deteriorating health of deposed President Bazoum mount.

title: Baby among two migrants dead after boat capsizes along Tunisia’s coast
description: More than 1,800 people have died on the Mediterranean route – the world’s deadliest – double last year's death toll.

title: Armenia calls for UN help on Nagorno-Karabakh’s humanitarian situation
description: Armenian diplomat accuses Azerbaijan of blocking the only available road connecting Nagorno-Karabakh with Armenia.

title: What lies ahead for Pakistan now that a new caretaker PM has been named?
description: Senator Anwar ul-Haq Kakar has been named as caretaker PM as Pakistan prepares for a general election within 90 days.

title: Women’s World Cup 2023: Fixtures and match schedule for semi-finals
description: The two knockout matches will be played on August 15 and August 16.

title: England beat Colombia 2-1 to set up World Cup semi-final with Australia
description: Russo and Hemp score for England as the Lionesses come back from a goal down to reach third consecutive semi-final.

title: Pakistan senator Anwar ul-Haq Kakar named caretaker PM ahead of vote
description: The little-known senator from Balochistan has been nominated to lead the country until its next general election.

title: Six dead after ‘migrant boat’ capsizes crossing from France to UK
description: Authorities say dozens rescued after boat carrying migrants to Britain sank in the English Channel early Saturday.

title: Hundreds rally in S Korea against Fukushima wastewater release plan
description: Activists are unhappy with Tokyo's plan to release treated radioactive water from Fukushima nuclear plant into ocean.

title: Taiwan vice president heads to United States on sensitive trip
description: William Lai is officially making only transit stops in the US on his way to and from Paraguay.

title: Australia beat France in penalty shootout thriller to reach World Cup semis
description: Australia reach Women's World Cup semi-finals for the first time after co-hosts beat France 7-6 in thrilling shootout.

title: Chasing hope, losing Omar: Five weeks with pancreatic cancer
description: In a clinic that offered hope for cancer patients who had been told there was none, I learned to face loss.

title: Toddler dies in US on a Texas migrant bus going to Chicago
description: The 3-year-old was being transported as part of the controversial Operation Lone Star border control program.

title: Bayern Munich sign England captain Harry Kane from Tottenham
description: Kane leaves Sours after 19 years at the club, where he became the second highest-scorer in Premier League history.

title: Yoshua Bengio: Democracy is not safe in an AI world
description: One of the fathers of artificial intelligence discusses the necessity of having regulations on AI technology.

title: Why are central banks hoarding gold?
description: The World Gold Council says gold purchases in the first half of this year were the highest on record.

title: Russia says 20 Ukrainian drones destroyed over Crimea
description: Russian defence ministry says 20 Ukrainian drones were shot down and electronically suppressed in early morning attack.

title: Biden’s ‘ticking time bomb’ remark referred to China’s economy: White House
description: US President told political fundraiser that China was 'in trouble' due to internal economic and social tensions.

title: Hawaii wildfire death toll hits 67 as probe launched into blaze response
description: Hawaii's attorney general opens investigation into official response to deadly wildfire.

title: Seven worshippers killed in northern Nigeria mosque collapse
description: Hundreds of people were inside the mosque for Friday prayers when part of the building collapsed, officials say.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 535
description: These are the main developments as the Russian invasion of Ukraine enters its 535th day.

title: US warns of ‘deteriorating conditions’ for Niger’s ousted President Bazoum
description: Media reports have emerged that Niger's president and his family are surviving on rice and pasta without electricity.
